surface_styles.card: bg-white border border-slate-200 shadow-sm rounded-lg hover:shadow-md transition-shadow duration-200
surface_styles.glass_header: bg-white/80 backdrop-blur-md border-b border-slate-200/50 sticky top-0 z-50
surface_styles.sidebar: bg-slate-900 text-slate-300 border-r border-slate-800 hidden md:flex flex-col w-64 fixed h-full

buttons.primary: bg-slate-900 text-white hover:bg-slate-800 rounded-md shadow-sm h-10 px-4 font-medium
buttons.secondary: bg-white text-slate-900 border border-slate-200 hover:bg-slate-50 shadow-sm h-10 px-4 font-medium

cards.kpi: flex flex-col justify-between p-6 bg-white border border-slate-200 rounded-lg shadow-sm relative overflow-hidden
cards.chart_container: p-6 bg-white border border-slate-200 rounded-lg shadow-sm

inputs.base: h-10 border-slate-200 focus:ring-2 focus:ring-slate-900/20 focus:border-slate-900 rounded-md bg-white
inputs.upload_zone: border-2 border-dashed border-slate-300 rounded-lg p-12 text-center hover:bg-slate-50 transition-colors cursor-pointer bg-slate-50/50

tables.wrapper: rounded-md border border-slate-200 overflow-hidden bg-white shadow-sm
tables.header: bg-slate-50 border-b border-slate-200 text-xs font-semibold uppercase tracking-wider text-slate-500

instructions_to_main_agent: 1. SETUP: Ensure Font Imports are in index.css. Use 'Manrope' for all headings and 'Inter' for body.
2. THEME: Use the provided color tokens in tailwind.config.js extension.
3. COMPONENTS: Heavily customize Shadcn components. Remove the default 'radius' if it looks too round (use rounded-md or rounded-lg).
4. LAYOUT: Implement the Sidebar Layout structure. Sidebar on left (fixed), Main Content on right (scrollable).
5. CHARTS: Create a generic 'ChartCard' component that wraps Chart.js canvases with the standard border/shadow styles defined in 'surface_styles'.
6. TABLES: Use Shadcn Table for the Data View. Add sorting icons and pagination.
7. PREDICTION: For the Prediction Result, use a 'Score Card' design - big number, color coded badge (Low/Medium/High) next to it.
8. DRAG DROP: Use 'react-dropzone' for the CSV upload area, styled with the 'upload_zone' token.
UNIVERSAL_GUIDELINES: You tend to converge toward generic, 'on distribution' outputs. In frontend design, this creates what users call the 'AI slop' aesthetic. Avoid this: make creative, distinctive frontends that surprise and delight.
Dark colors look good when used independently without gradients. DO NOT use dark colors as gradients
Don't make generic centered layouts, simplistic gradients, and uniform styling.
Create depth through layered design elements with z-index hierarchy
Use glass-morphism effects with backdrop filters (12-24px blur)
You MUST NOT apply universal transition. Eg: transition: all. This results in breaking transforms. Always add transitions for specific interactive elements like button, input excluding transforms
You MUST NOT center align the app container, ie do not add .App { text-align: center; } in the css file. This disrupts the human natural reading flow of text
Always use modern button styles like pill-shaped, or sharp button with interaction animations & color relevant to the app style
NEVER: use AI assistant Emoji characters like ðŸ¤–ðŸ§ ðŸ’­ðŸ’¡ðŸ”®ðŸŽ¯ðŸ“š etc for icons.
Every interaction needs micro-animations - hover states, transitions, parallax effects, and entrance animations. Static = dead.
Use 2-3x more spacing than feels comfortable. Cramped designs look cheap.
Subtle grain textures, noise overlays, custom cursors, selection states, and loading animations: separates good from extraordinary.
Main agent relies on these image URLs. Missing categories = main agent will use placeholder text which is FORBIDDEN
Prioritize using pre-existing components from src/components/ui when applicable
Components MUST use named exports (export const ComponentName = ...)
Pages MUST use default exports (export default function PageName() {...})
All interactive and key informational elements MUST include a 'data-testid' attribute
